repnme.cdata!:
Republic of Yemen - Emergency Social Safety
            Net Enhancement (EC Food Facility Grant) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Emergency Social Safety
            Net Enhancement (EC Food Facility Grant) Project for
            Republic of Yemen were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was moderate,
            the Bank performance was satisfactory, and the Grantee
            performance was also satisfactory. There were six lessons
            learned: 1) Emergency operations embedded within the context
            of ongoing country strategies can be effective instruments.
            2) The results framework and expected outcomes and outputs
            should be designed to reflect what an operation can
            reasonably accomplish and measure during implementation. 3)
            A countrywide suspension of disbursements can be especially
            troublesome in the context of an emergency operation,
            especially one that channels assistance to the poor and
            disadvantaged. 4) Public works programs need to be adapted
            to gender realities. 5) Public works programs need to be
            adapted to local realities. 6) Experience with direct
            implementation (through communities) shows that it is very
            management intensive.

16418228.trustfund:
TF095879-YEMEN Emergency Social Safety
            Net Enhancement Project,TF095790-Yemen Social Safety Net
            Enhancement Project

repnme.cdata!:
Yemen - Emergency Social Safety Net
            Enhancement Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Emergency Social
            Safety Net Enhancement Project for Yemen is to contribute to
            the reduction of the negative impact of food price
            volatility on the poor and vulnerable in selected areas, and
            support the protection and building of community assets in
            poor communities. The extension is necessary to allow the
            Social Welfare Fund to complete the cash transfer to 40,000
            households which has been delayed due to the prevailing
            country situation and the consequent suspension of
            disbursement for the Yemen portfolio on July 28, 2011. In
            accordance with OP 13.30, the team confirms that: (i) the
            project development objective continues to be achievable;
            (ii) the performance of the implementing agencies is
            satisfactory based on the most recent supervision mission in
            December 2011; (iii) an action plan has been prepared by the
            Implementing Agency and agreed with the Bank to ensure
            successful completion of the Project; (iv) the Grant is
            fully committed, and acceptable audit reports have been
            received for the 2010 calendar year; and (v) suspension of
            disbursement was lifted on January 20, 2012.

Yemen - Emergency Social Safety
            Net Enhancement Project : restructuring  (Vol. 2) : Data sheet

12956333.trustfund:
TF095790-Yemen Social Safety Net
            Enhancement Project,TF095879-YEMEN Emergency Social Safety
            Net Enhancement Project

repnme.cdata!:
Yemen - Emergency Social Safety Net
            Enhancement Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Emergency Social
            Safety Net Enhancement Project for Yemen is to contribute to
            the reduction of the negative impact of food price
            volatility on the poor and vulnerable in selected areas, and
            support the protection and building of community assets.
            Negative measures include: air pollution, water pollution,
            soil pollution, waste management, loss of vegetation, and
            waste management. Mitigation measures include: a) collecting
            and transporting construction wastes to the approved
            location; b) construct the communal taps at the selected
            locations; c) restoring vegetation cover equal to that
            before the sub-project; d) construct the slaughter house in
            the location specified in the Tender Documents (TD); and e)
            implement the drainage system according to TD.

display_title.display_title:
Yemen - Emergency Social Safety
            Net Enhancement Project : environmental assessment (Vol. 2)
            : Environmental management plan
